website_summaries.verdict: The best overall handheld pool vacuum for heavy-duty cleaning in pool and pond areas.
pros: Large profile gives the vacuum plenty of interior space to collect debris while in use
Designed to work in murky waters
Good for both pool use and pond use for landscaping
cons: Bulky design makes it difficult to navigate around obstacles in the yard or near the pool

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been the past 10 years????
customer_reviews.text: Well...after years of draining my rock bottom pond & spending countless hours and tons of money on chemicals to keep the sludge & algae at bay...THIS vacuum is by far the best investment I have made. With a little bit of patience & learning how to angle and maneuver the attachments, this vacuum has cleaned the bottom of my pond beautifully. No more chemicals needed and my OCD can be put to rest. I highly recommend this item!!
customer_reviews.author: Cryochic

customer_reviews.title: Broke on the second use
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this vacuum two months ago. I just used it today for the second time and the motor failed. I opened the can and can see a broken disc inside the motor. For as much as this thing costs, it should last longer than two uses. I am calling OASE on the warranty and will update my review to reflect the level of customer service that I receive.
customer_reviews.author: RYAN TATTERSFIELD

customer_reviews.title: Not good for large ponds
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a large backyard koi pond. It is a waste of money for this application. The ground needs to be level or suction is reduced. I have areas where the pond bank is raised 3-4 feet for a waterfall and it can not create enough suction to efficiently vacuum the areas below. Also, you realistically need to have multiple areas for the waste tube to drain all the muck if your pond is large otherwise it just gets drained into your yard, walk ways, patio etc.. Bottom line is this is too expensive and really isn’t a great solution for cleaning a large pond.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Long but easy job
customer_reviews.text: The Pondovac 4 did a wonderful job. The pond had gotten out of hand with an overgrowth of water lilies that caused a lot of muck. The koi did not have to be removed. I sat on the edge of the pond and got the job done on my 8' X 12' pond. I'm female, under 140 pounds, and over 80 years. I did buy more drainage tubing to reach flower beds..
customer_reviews.author: TXWhite

customer_reviews.title: Does the job with little fuss
customer_reviews.text: It works great. Good suction. We found that the simplest attachment, the one without wheels, worked the best. The dual chamber design is effective. I was a little worried that the 1800 watts might overload the circuit but, at least if this is the only thing active on my 15 amp circuit, there is no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bertilak

customer_reviews.title: on the second or third attempt to use that the motor smelled like it was burning and it would just shut down
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying this product and my second one star rating. I waited two years and hoped things were better.. The motor was definitely stronger and seemed to be working okay.THEN....2 weeks past the return window and it DIED!! Be careful, this is not a good product. Boy do I feel screwed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Oel Wingo

customer_reviews.title: Wow - this is very useful
customer_reviews.text: Order the higher priced product and I'm glad that I did. Works perfectly and as described. Very pleased with how it continues to remove debris from the pond and empties one side of the cannister while the other side is filling so it's continuous operation - no stopping to drain which is exactly what I needed and wanted. Easy to put together - easy to operate and easy to clean. What's not to like about this very useful tool. Highly recommend it. Expensive but worth the extra money to get a device that really does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: G. B.

customer_reviews.title: Must have for pond owners
customer_reviews.text: We constructed our pond in the low area on our property. Unfortunately we have some surrounding trees and we get our fair share of leaves. This vacuum is a must for cleaning ponds with similar issues. The dual zone reservoir works flawlessly. we pump the waste water into the mesh bag that was included. Leaves out, water back into pond. No need to stop for flushing like when you use a shop vacuum. Worth the extra $$
customer_reviews.author: Eherrmann

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the cost!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 35' stream and a 7500 gallon pond with 9 large fish, the muck and plant debris was hard to "net" and remove. I have used this vacuum on both areas and am so pleased with the removal, how easy the unit is to use and how easy it is to retain the water that is being removed for use on my plants. One attachment lets me clean the rocks in my stream without sucking up the small rocks, really helpful! I would definitely buy this unit again and recommend it to friends. Only drawback for me is the length of the discharge hose...will be looking for an extension to add to the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, Continuous Suction!
customer_reviews.text: I used this in my 7' deep pond. Comes with many attachments that I don't use, but it cut my annual pond cleaning in half since it continuously has suction. It appears to be a very sturdy vacuum. Just be sure to attach the hose on securely in front or it won't operate properly. Also, I wish the out take hose fit more securely. There's no way to tighten it and it repeatedly has fallen off with the slightest movement. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Had high hopes
customer_reviews.text: I paid additional money to by the Oase 4 because I had a small pond-2 ft deep--and a large pond 4+ feet deep. After days of using it I managed to clean the small pond (mostly by flushing the regular filter daily), but when I tried it in the large pond it didn't have the vacuum power to pull up the sludge, even though the company said it could vacuum 4-6 feet (the makes say 7 feet). Tomorrow I am going to stand IN the pond and see if it will work. All in all I do feel that I did not get my moneys worth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning ponds and saving your back!
customer_reviews.text: We have a small fish pond, that makes cleaning difficult because of its design (rock wall on one side that provides access). This cleaner is great at removing the hard to get to sludge at the bottom of the pond. What a back saver!! I didn't have any trouble with the vacuuming, just read the instructions on what to expect. It still does take time to remove the sludge but it saves your back from the bending over to remove the stuff. Have to be careful to not vacuum up small rocks and sticks that can clog the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Trillium Star

customer_reviews.title: Seller was fast in shipping and was delivered in 2 Days
customer_reviews.text: I like the clear plastic piece on the wand so you can see the water flowing. As others have stated it does stop and go don’t know the reason but being patient it does a nice job my pond is 25x30
customer_reviews.author: Keith M

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have hesitated to purchase a pond pump for years. Now that I have, I wish I had sooner. This is great for gathering debris from the bottom of my pond, 3 1/2 feet deep. It sucked loose gravel, leaves and even twigs out. It also helped in lowering the level of the pond for water exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Reh

customer_reviews.title: Works like a gem
customer_reviews.text: Bought for waterfall pond but before I could clean that we tested out on super dirty algae filled pool after winter. Couldn’t even see the bottom of pool but started vacuuming what we knew was there. When water cleared the bottom of pool was very clean and all the gunk was sucked out to waste (worms, dirt, algae, and more) Since no chemicals were in yet, the grass would love the yucky nutrients. Did not kill grass. One week and pool was swim ready. Now time for pond cleaning!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: It just doesn't keep working. The valve/float system that switches from one tank to the other is prone to malfunction. It loses suction after a few minutes of working. Constant disassembly and fiddling with the plumbing sometimes gets it working again - sometimes not. The suction is inadequate to lift from the bottom of my 36" deep pond with a one-foot tall stone edge - so 48" of total lift. It works great when I vacuum a shallow section - only one-foot deep. But it's just not suited for a three-foot deep pond.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Light

customer_reviews.title: Great cleaning power for ponds and water features.
customer_reviews.text: We had heavy rain run off that filled our water feature with mud. This thing sucked all the mud and silt right out. I didn’t discharge the water back into the our river as the provided filter bag is only good for leaves. Still totally worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Amazn junki

customer_reviews.title: mixed review
customer_reviews.text: I have been using mine for the past couple days - just got it - and for the most part it works ok. One problem I am having is that it loses suction frequently and I have to turn it off and back on again to get it to regain suction. That is a pain in the butt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a pondovac 4, received a pondovac classic instead.  WTF
customer_reviews.text: Deceptive listing. I was supposed to get Pondovac 4, I go cheaper pondovac classic.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Must have for pond owners
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this. We have had a couple of ponds and never had a pond vac. After reading review and watching all of the videos I decided on this one. Well worth the price. Unit is well thought out. Easy to assemble, use, clean up and put away so it is not an all day chore to get this out and use it when you think it needs a little cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Shopsalot

customer_reviews.title: Worked really great.
customer_reviews.text: I was very satisfied with the pond vac. I did have one that is about 10 years old and decided to up grade. Very glad I did. I did have an issue with smaller rocks getting stuck but resolved the issue by using a crevice tool from another vac, which allowed me to clean in between larger rocks that were full of leaves. I liked the idea of continuously being able to vacuum and not waiting for the water to empty like my older model. I now have a clean pond and my fish are happy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Nicely designed
customer_reviews.text: This pondvac worked exactly as I had hoped on my 4000 gallon pond. I cleared the larger leaves from the pond with a skimmer net and then was able to easily clean the remaining silt and debriis using the pondvac. The mechanism to switch between the two tanks works great and the handle extensions are more then enough for my pond.
customer_reviews.author: John21042

customer_reviews.title: Cleans pond area  Less work involved
customer_reviews.text: This was defective has no suction power so returned and waiting for my refund so can reorder another.. I have had three before in past years and they work great.
customer_reviews.author: dmretired

customer_reviews.title: For the price we were disappointed with the performance
customer_reviews.text: For the price we were disappointed with the performance. It spends more time clogged than it does sucking up muck. It doesn't take much to plug it and takes some time to get it unplugged only to have it plug up again a couple of minutes later. It is very picky about how and where you have it set up. On our pond it is almost useless, on the above ground pool it works great, so it is not a total loss. Too bad we bought it for the pond
customer_reviews.author: Randy D.

customer_reviews.title: Learning curve
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum did a great job of cleaning my 3500 gallon pond it took a little while to get comfortable with Only because I had a considerable amount of string algae and it would clog the attachment, suction was great I would recommend using a net to get out larger debris but to remove silt this rocks. The power cord is short but you can use an extension I didn't feel the waste hose was to short although other people felt differently overall I would recommend this and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Dancergirl

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: If I had to purchase it again I WOULD however I Don't have to purchase it again because it is a quality pond vac and hasn't quit working yet and it does such a good job that it even catches any sand in my pond and bags it for me for easy removal.
customer_reviews.author: Peg Leg

customer_reviews.title: FUSTRATED!!
customer_reviews.text: This pondovac just does not work... it kills me that I wasted my money on this worthless piece of equipment. As some others said it goes for about few seconds working great and then all of a sudden it stops everything in the hose goes back into pond and I have to shut it off reset it and then it goes for a few more seconds it would take me a year to clean my pond (4,000 gallons)... crazy! I have given up and looking for an answer. I just sent a technical request to Oase.
customer_reviews.author: marknti

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: This little machine is AWESOME! WE have a small water feature w/waterfall in our yard, with fish. However, we were having a VERY hard time keeping it cleaned. The Oase Pondovac 4 does EVERYTHING they promised. It is also a fairly compact item to store when you're done. Just one tip: try to always run some clean water through your Pondovac after you're done with the yucky stuff, otherwise you get little pockets of mucky stuff inside and in the flexible hoses that will molder a bit. Would I buy again? OH YES!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Works great for our koi pond
customer_reviews.text: Works great for our koi pond. The reviewer who explained how to use the product properly was spot on! He should write the instructions for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: took some practice to get the hang of using it on our pool and spa and fountain. works well. definitely need to clean between uses
customer_reviews.author: RDB

customer_reviews.title: Marginal Quality
customer_reviews.text: Brought this as an upgrade from an earlier model I had purchased which just did work well at all. This one works but stops a lot which it was not supposed to do. Clogs very easy. My Shop Vac does a much better job. Keeping it but not pleased with overall performance.
customer_reviews.author: A. NASH

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I am using the vacuum to clean up pond that has 8 years of accumulation of sludge and leaves. I like everything. Works good and easier than manually trying to remove the accumulation.
customer_reviews.author: Sadi

customer_reviews.title: Poor suction on the pro version after using the pro ...
customer_reviews.text: Poor suction on the pro version after using the pro version 2 years ago that had far better suction and faster disscharge than the current version I would not buy the pro version again. Also after ussing this for 2 days tje vacuum didnt start again. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile - constant pumping.
customer_reviews.text: I like this device. It constantly pumps the water out - avoids stopping and emptying like most other pond vacs. This just pumps the water out constantly keeping the debris in the filter bag on the end of the output hose. Long long lead and output hose - super long extension arm and multiple tools.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Ease of operation
customer_reviews.text: This unit works just like it says it will. I used to take me days to move all of the sediments to the filter of my Koi pond. Now in just over one hour I can clean this pond (around 1,500 gallons) cleaner that it ever has been. The 2 stage chamber makes it so you never have to wait while it discharges the dirty water. LOVE THIS UNIT!!!
customer_reviews.author: P. H. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment, the replacement unit is missing the plastic return ...
customer_reviews.text: Received this item a week ago and found two defective parts, one smashed aluminum tube and a smashed plastic return hose adapter. Ordered a replacement unit the same day, received the replacement unit today (5 days later). Big disappointment, the replacement unit is missing the plastic return hose adapter. Now I am stuck with two defective units, both going back to amazon. What a pain having to pack them back up and drop them off at USPS. I would give it a minus 5 stars if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Helen C

customer_reviews.title: Home Run!!! Big Time!!
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant Execution of a Great Idea! It just works, period The rubber flapper valves are a brilliant idea The one clear section on the wand so you can see when you are done in a spot and move on The kill suction on the handle so you can just drop a snail that you sucked up and is clogging the end If you have a pond this is a MUST GET item for all.
customer_reviews.author: john balletto

customer_reviews.title: Gotta take you time, but it gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It is slowly getting muck out of my pond. I have a couple of years of build up, so a lot of leaves and sticks. This pump is holding up well to a couple of hours use each night as I slowly clean the stuff out.
customer_reviews.author: Russell C. Cole

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome pond vac
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome pond vac. I would recommend it. I have a fairly large pond 18 x 25 6 feet deep and I can reach pretty much all areas. The drainage hose could be a bit longer.
customer_reviews.author: Woodsmomma

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the aggravation
customer_reviews.text: Constantly looses suction. Motor overheated and had to be reset multiple times. Very slow process. I really wish there was a better option.
customer_reviews.author: sean McCullough

customer_reviews.title: Only works on flat surfaces
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this did not work for our pond which has a lot of big, medium, and small rocks. The main attachments are flat sweepers(big medium and small) made for flat surfaces. The two crevice kind attachements will clean the rocks but will take forever to clean a good size pond. They will also suck smaller rocks and clog the vacuum. if you have a flat floors without any rocky surfaces this should work Ok.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Hoped return water clear, did not do this.
customer_reviews.text: Great suction. Good construction. Cleaning a 1900 gallon fountain. Return water is not clear, it is very clean, 90% clean. Also using an aftermarket filter bad on exhaust hose.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Better than any wet/dry vacuum
customer_reviews.text: works perfect no complaints. I have two water features of a pond and a waterfall. This vac is much better than my traditional wet/dry shop vacuum, should have been purchased awhile ago.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Use as pool vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Works well. It would be more effective if one of the attachments had some flex to it so it would work better on the sides of the pool. Saves a lot on paying a pool service company to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Bohorfoush

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectations
customer_reviews.text: First time ever writing a review. I have a 4’ deep koi pond. This product out preformed my expectations. It managed to suck up all the debris off the bottom and put clean water back in. Only thing I improved on was the fastening of the debris bag to the hose. I used dryer vent clamp , smaller to fasten the bag.
customer_reviews.author: IAN M MCGEARY

customer_reviews.title: Saved my pond
customer_reviews.text: Had a huge mess in my pond from a plant I bought that had clay it. This is the only way I was able to clear my water. I was able to suck up the Silt by the end of the day I could see my face again! Easy to use easy to clean highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Bradley

customer_reviews.title: I had an initial start up difficulty...
customer_reviews.text: I had an initial start up difficulty with one of the two internal cylinder valves. One of the plastic cylinder rings was not install properly causing the cylinder to stick. I removed the cylinder, position the ring into it's mating cylinder groove, and from that point on the unit has worked properly. I also wished the suction was a bit more powerful, but all-in-all I am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D.W.

customer_reviews.title: A must for the koi pond owner
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd Oase Pondovac. I end up wearing them out (big koi pond, lots of stuff to extract). Each one reminds me what a delight it is to have a good vacuum to help me keep up with my pond.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: Ok product it's hard to pick up piles of leaves on bottom unless u use open attachment but then u end up sucking up rocks, it has real good suction. Also it seemed I had to a few times turn off power to unit to Reset vacuuming bc it stopped sucking the float part must have got stuck so it stopped sucking. The delivery from seller was bad it took almost 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: dariano

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Tried this thing for the first time today, it sucked up a lot of the scum from the waterfall pools. Only wish it came with a wider end attachment with a brush instead of the one thats toothbrush sized pretty much. I like the clear handle attachment so you can see it working
customer_reviews.author: Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Recommend....very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box and up and running in about 15 min. My pond was dark green water when I started. After about 4 hours of vacum and a day for everything to settle, the water is clear and I can now see the bottom of the pond.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Totally love it and how easy it is to use and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a one other pond vac that cost a 100 dollars more. This new vac put my old one to shame. Totally love it and how easy it is to use and clean!
customer_reviews.author: TCherry

customer_reviews.title: I love it. I am glad to be able to ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I am glad to be able to clean my own pond and not have to spend rediculous amounts hiring someone to do it.. It is worth what it costs. It does an excellent job and not hard to understand how to use.
customer_reviews.author: Budzski

customer_reviews.title: Our pond has never looked so good with such little effort
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money... Used it one whole season before I wrote this review... Our pond has never looked so good with such little effort.
customer_reviews.author: bm64

customer_reviews.title: Have Pond? Need This!
customer_reviews.text: We should have bought one of these years ago! Love that you can clean and pump strained water back in! So easy to use and clean!!!
customer_reviews.author: Watchar

customer_reviews.title: CLEANING MADE EASY
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum, I have a 1000 gallon koi pond and decided to purchase this vacuum to clean the pond myself versus continuing to pay the escalating cost of having it done. Simple to assemble and use, this vacuum was half the cost of a normal seasonal cleaning for my pond. If I have a complaint it would be for them to include a storage bag for all the parts as well as a longer discharge hose that the one provided (2.5m or 8 feet). They do sell an extension so why not include it.
customer_reviews.author: Donovan E Robotham

customer_reviews.title: Product works great. Has 2 tanks and fills one and empties ...
customer_reviews.text: Product works great. Has 2 tanks and fills one and empties it into the other for continuous use without having to empty the tank manually. Has good suction.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I used it to clean my 5
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I used it to clean my 5.5 feet pool. I live in the desert and I do not have a filter to waste. I use this to clean the dirt at the bottom without having to have it run through my filter. However, the dispose hose is only 5 feet, so I had to extend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep the valve slightly open for better suction
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my pond. Doesn’t like larger nuts or pecans. All in all great product
customer_reviews.author: Justin M.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Pond Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this sooner. An excellent pond vacuum that operates as specified.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gans

customer_reviews.title: Does’t work on items like acorns and leaves.
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is great for sucking up “sludge” from the bottom of your pond. However, it doesn’t work on larger items such a acorns. Even leaves and pine needles that aren’t decomposed will clog the vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Ladzinski

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment !
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very happy with the pondovac4. I used to spend hours trying to get the sludge out of my pond. It took way less time and effort with the pond vac. I don't like to spend this much money on a tool, but I don't regret a penny of it. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Leaking Air - Poor Experience
customer_reviews.text: Little to no suction, with leaking on the lid and air hose. Seems like was sent a vacuum that had already been sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!!!
customer_reviews.text: Reading some of the negative posts had me a little worried. I am here to say that I couldn't be happier with the performance. It does everything I need it to do. My pond is almost 3 feet deep and it sucks the sludge right off the bottom. No problem at all. I love the adjustable suction as well it comes in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 35000 gallon Koi pond that is 4-8 ft deep. This vac works fantastic! Easy to maintain and clean, has great suction, love it!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: That it has an intake land outtake aye the same time finamenal job
customer_reviews.text: It's a great item puts other wet vex to shame
customer_reviews.author: Congregation Givath Shoul

customer_reviews.title: This works
customer_reviews.text: I rarely review products but I am thrilled with this purchase. It was easy to put together, worked the very first time and worked even better than I expected it to. I am using this in an inground pool to pick up debris and sand that were inadvertently dumped into it during a renovation project nearby and I could not be happier with the way this worked when nothing else did. My only (small) complaint is that the extensions come loose sometimes as you're working in deeper water and it's a pain to fish them out and start again. Overall though it's a small issue because - this works! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa M

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the other negative reviews. Unless you have a small water feature avoid this product! It simply doesn’t work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dressander

customer_reviews.title: Item is no good
customer_reviews.text: Pay for the shipping and I’ll send you mine for free. This item is garbage. It does not work well and doesn’t properly vacuum a pond. I can’t believe I fell for the positive reviews and bought this expensive item.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product but expelled water hose come apart very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Pep12

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.text: Works just like all the other reviews indicate. My pond was filthy as it had not been cleaned in years and I recently had contractors spill sand as they were laying a paver patio. Took about an hour a day over several days (because I didn't want to have lose too much water at a time), but the water is crystal clear and my Koi are happy campers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: better in pool takes a lot of trial and error in pond but I GLAD I BOUGHT IT
customer_reviews.author: lungunie

customer_reviews.title: Thr Ultimate Pond Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I love this Vacuum! It works great and comes with lots of attachments. Most pond vacs are single chambered which results in frequent interruptions while the chamber drains. The dual chamber design allows for continuous performance. I purchased the single chamber design in the past to save some money and ended up regretting it. When I moved and built my current pond I knew I wasn`t going to make that mistake again. This unit performed even better than expected and my expectations were pretty high.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Lindgren

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I was looking for...
customer_reviews.text: The unit performs as advertised, really helped clean up my pond.
customer_reviews.author: William Joseph Mullen

customer_reviews.title: The cost was a fraction of the cost of paying to have our pond cleaned. Would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: This little machine did an amazing job of cleaning our pond/ waterfall. Just wish we had discovered it sooner !
customer_reviews.author: edie demshar

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product. Easy to use and effective quick pond appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Liveitup99

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. Easy to use. Instructions clear. Easy to clean!!
customer_reviews.author: Edith couch

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Poor Instructions for such a expensive product
customer_reviews.text: What a horrible instructions for installation.. extremely poor steps ..
customer_reviews.author: Prakash K.

customer_reviews.title: Works if you have patience
customer_reviews.text: This vaccum does work but it takes some trial and error. It also does not handle large amounts of debris very well. It will do the job, but it takes a while and you have to pull out any large leaves/acorns prior to vaccuming. I have a large pond with many rocks. I think this vaccum would work very better in a pool or in a smaller pond with a smooth bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Law Gans

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Wasted $350. Used it 6 times in 2 years and now it quit working.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for the first 6 uses, but this month we pulled it out to clean up the pond and it started to work, but then quit. The motor still runs fine, but it will not switch between the systems to keep the discharge going. Sent an email to Oase over a week ago and never heard from them. There is no phone number on the Oase website to call them. When it worked, it worked great. But now it's useless. Totally wasted $350. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Stickman

customer_reviews.title: A nub was broken on the intake apparatus.  It works, but for how long?
customer_reviews.text: The intake apparatus has two nubs on it to fit tightly and securely into the intake hole. One nub was broken. Otherwise the machine works and I hope it won't be too loose in the future for the suction to lighten up.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once but i had no issues once I got the hang of it. You have to read the directions. When it arrived, one wheel was broken and the suction hose had a kink in it. I opened a damaged claim online and they were in contact with me by email within 10 minutes. Sent the parts out that day with tracking information follow-up.. I was impressed.
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product little big ! Works amazing thank you !
customer_reviews.author: gilmar soares silva

customer_reviews.title: Pond Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Just what we've been hoping for for years....easy to use, works well and cleans great!!! Worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: kelly J

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This worked amazingly well. I wish I would have bought one years ago. The time it will take to clean our pond now will only be 20- 30 mins versus a full day project and wasting tons of water. I would recommend this to everyone that has a pond with koi.
customer_reviews.author: RTBrinker

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: This machine is well designed and is doing an excellent job so far. I would like the option to be able to add on a longer dump hose. The suction tubes are well made but can be difficult to get apart after use. However, I am very happy with the results that I am getting with the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Seeber

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: makes cleaning fish pond very easy. easy to repair if parts need to be replaced
customer_reviews.author: margaret hansen

customer_reviews.title: Great suction
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4500 gallon pond and it cleans algae from the bottom really well.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Crotty

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective
customer_reviews.text: Great time saver and very effective. I would give it a five but the Vac does not do well with small rocks; it's so powerful it will vacuum them up and the impact the performance of the cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: David & Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Water Garden Vacuum and more
customer_reviews.text: This beats any shop vacuum for removing water from my water garden or my boat! Simple to use and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Al Mc

customer_reviews.title: Should have done this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase. Finally the muck is gone off the pond pebbles! This will save big $$ in yearly pond cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores H

customer_reviews.title: Pondovac 4 vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Liked the powerful suction pump. However the attachable bag didn't work too good for my pond as I had a lot of sludge! The attachment for the gravel did not stay in place and my husband had to tape it so that the gravel would not be sucked up. Other than these two items it worked very well. I have a 18' by 15' pond that is about 3' deep in the channel from the waterfall to the skimmer.
customer_reviews.author: ELLEN LARSON

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum is ok, not great
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good. Doesn't vacuum up the debris from the pond as well as advertised. Not sure if it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time. Works as advertised. I would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Michael D Mechsner

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with the machine and post sale service of Seller
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Pondovact 4 from Amazon thru The WaterGardener Inc. The machine did not perform as expected. WaterGardener Inc. was very cooperative in sending a replacement. The replacement worked as advertised and I am satisfied with the purchase. I was extremely pleased with the way the seller stood behind the product and resolved my initial problems.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome A. Lemire

customer_reviews.title: Pondovac Review
customer_reviews.text: This pond vac works great but I would like to see more suction power. With a 3 foot deep pond, it does not have a huge amount of suction when working at maximum distance using all the extension tubes. A great product for maintenance cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: David Shellie

customer_reviews.title: a good pond cleaner
customer_reviews.text: an excellent machine, that cycles and discharges well, Have had little difficult with jamming.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: I just received this to use on my pond and it works great. Yes you have to read the manual, yes you have to learn the right tip to use on it but it worked great. Much better than the shop vac we'd tried before.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Phibbs

customer_reviews.title: This vac sucks
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful suction. I have used it twice on my koi pond. It does a real good job. I have small pea gravel in bottom and sometimes one will get hung up in rubber flaps and machine will lose suction. My pond has never looked better. With a little effort and time it cleaned the bottom of my pond and I can see all the fish.
customer_reviews.author: cloyce rankin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for 3 years almost ,It's been working great!
customer_reviews.author: MM

product_meta.title: OASE 032232 Pondovac 4 Pond Vacuum Cleaner
product_meta.description: Oase Pondovac 4 Pond Vacuum Cleaner. Do not operate or leave the unit in the rain.Easy to clean
feature_bullets: Discharge Hose Length: 8 Ft, Max; Flow Rate: 1300 Gph

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars311 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
